action_card_description: Protect your internal and SaaS applications behind a layer of Zero Trust policies. Each application type has its own requirements.
action_card_private_bp1: Know the value of your Destination IP or SNI
action_card_private_bp2: Create a tunnel and install cloudflared
action_card_self_bp_2: Change your domain nameservers to Cloudflare
additional_rules_description: If you're assigning one or more groups to this application, any rules you create now will be applied in addition to group rules.
app_domain_contains_wildcard: **Warning:** This domain contains a wildcard, so no DNS record will be created. Read more on <0>managing DNS records </0>
app_domain_invalid: **Warning:** No DNS record found for this domain. The policy may not execute as expected.
app_path_invalid_wildcard: Paths may contain at most one wildcard between each slash.
app_private_policies_info_message: **Note:** Policies you create here can also be viewed and managed under <0>**Gateway > Network policies**</0>.
app_subdomain_invalid_wildcard: Subdomains may contain at most one wildcard between each dot.
apps_limit_reached:
You've reached the maximum
number of applications allowed.
<0>Learn more
apps_limit_reached_no_line_break: You've reached the maximum number of applications allowed. <0>Learn more</0>
auth_idp_empty_desc: You can integrate your organization's identity provider with Cloudflare Access. Your team can simultaneously use multiple providers, reducing friction when working with partners or contractors.
auth_redirect_setting: Skip identity provider selection if only one is configured
auth_select_idp_description: Manually select identity providers users can use to connect to this application
auth_select_idp_description_not_app: Manually select identity providers users can use to connect
bookmark_type_description: If you have apps that cannot be put behind Access, we provide a shortcut on our App Launcher
config_api_delete_error: There was an error deleting your application
config_app_groups_table_description: Assign a group to your application to enforce a set of predefined rules.
config_cancel_msg: You will lose any changes made to this application.
config_cancel_msg_rule: You will lose any changes made to this rule.
config_description: Configure the policies, authentication, and settings of your applications.
config_error_host_required: Application IP or host is required.
config_error_name_over_max_limit_letters: Application names must be less than %{limit} characters.
config_error_valid_image_url: Please provide a valid image URL
delete_desc: Are you sure you want to delete this Application?
delete_desc_rule: Are you sure you want to delete this policy?
description: Protect your Self-Hosted, SaaS and Private applications with Zero Trust policies. Only users who match your policies will have access to your configured applications.
empty_state_add_policies_card_descriptio: Create policies to grant or deny permission to a certain user or user group. You can create, edit, or delete policies at any time.
empty_state_add_policies_card_learn_more: Learn more about policies and settings
empty_state_configure_application_card_d: Add your application details and select an identity provider (IdP) as a login method. If no IdP is configured, your application will use a one-time pin.
empty_state_description: Protect your applications behind a layer of Zero Trust policies.
empty_state_modal_pvt_network_know_value: Know the value of your Destination IP or SNI
empty_state_modal_saas_obtain_assertion_: Obtain your Assertion Consumer Service URL
empty_state_modal_self_hosted_change_dom: Change your domain nameservers to Cloudflare
empty_state_setup_access_desc: Access protects your internal and SaaS applications by enforcing Zero Trust policies. Before allowing users to reach your applications, Access will check every request for device health and user identity.
error_device_posture_api: Failed to retrieve device posture rules
group_unavailable_for_bypass_service_aut: Groups containing identity rules cannot be assigned to Bypass or Service Auth policies
isolation_required_description: Require this application to be served in an isolated browser for users matching this policy.
leave_saas_app_config_message: You can configure your application later, but current changes will not be saved. Until configured, your users will not be able to log in to this application through Access.
leave_without_saving_warning_desc: You've made changes to the rules or settings on this page, press 'Save' to keep them.
no_access_app_description:
Access protects your internal and SaaS applications by putting a layer of Zero Trust policies in front of them.

When users request to access an application behind Cloudflare Zero Trust, each request is checked for device health and user identity. Only users who match your policies will be allowed in.
no_access_app_more_info: Read our <0>documentation</0> on adding applications to Cloudflare Zero Trust.
no_access_or_teams: For more information on our subscription plans, see the <0>Zero Trust pricing page</0>.
no_additional_settings: No additional settings can be configured with this action.
no_edit_perm: You do not have permissions to perform this action
no_groups_notification: **Did you know?** Groups allow you to create a set of reusable conditions to apply across your Access policies. Set up your first group under <0>Access</0>.
no_groups_rule_description: The rules you create here define who can or cannot reach your application.
no_rules_warning_desc: Rules define who can access an application since Access by default blocks everything. Without any rules, no one will have access to this application.
overview_app_domain_conflict: Domain is already associated with an existing application
overview_application_appearance_descript: Customize your application's app launcher appearance, behavior, and messaging. <0>Manage app launcher settings.</0>
overview_aud_tooltop: You will need this value if you are validating the Cloudflare Access JWT in your application.
overview_block_page_settings_desc: Choose what an end-user will see if they fail to meet the criteria for identity or non-identity based policies. <0>Learn more about block pages</0>
overview_custom_deny_message_description: Redirect users to this webpage when they are denied access.
overview_custom_error_message_desc: Create a custom login page message for users who are denied access
overview_icon_customisation_application_: Image can be PNG, JPG, JPEG, or SVG. We recommend using a square logo, either color or black.
overview_icon_customisation_description: This will appear in the App Launcher and the main Applications page.
overview_saas_access_identity_id_sub: The unique identifier of your SaaS application. Sometimes referred to as the IDP Entity ID.
overview_saas_access_saml_metadata_sub: The location of your SaaS application's SAML metadata.
overview_saas_application_sub: Select an application. If your app is not listed, type its name to save.
overview_saas_config_endpoint_sub: The endpoint where configuration details are retrieved from.
overview_saas_consumer_service_url_sub: The service provider's endpoint (URL) that is responsible for receiving and parsing a SAML assertion.
overview_saas_default_relay_state_sub: URL to direct users to after successful SAML authentication.
overview_saas_identity_id_sub: A globally unique name for an Identity or Service Provider.
overview_saas_name_id_format_sub: The value we provide to the SaaS application in the subject field.
overview_saas_redirect_urls_error: Provide at least one redirect URL
overview_saas_redirect_urls_sub: Add permitted URLs for Cloudflare to return Authorization codes and Access/ID tokens
overview_saas_saml_attribute_statements_: Configure any additional statements required by your SaaS Provider.
overview_saas_scopes_sub: Define the user information shared with Access.
overview_saas_token_endpoint_sub: The endpoint where an authorization code and access/ID tokens are exchanged.
overview_visibility_app_launcher_url_des: Choose the URL for this application in the App Launcher
overview_visibility_desc: Application domains that contain wildcards (*) will not display in App Launcher.
overview_visibility_use_default_domain: Use default (first domain will be used):
policy_config_no_include_error: Policies must have included criteria. Add a group or a new "Include" rule.
policy_config_non_allowed_identity_rule: Service Auth or Bypass policies cannot include identity-based conditions
policy_level_ssh_logging_tooltip: SSH logging at the policy level will record SSH activity for any user that is allowed by this specific policy. To download SSH logs, add your encryption key under Settings > Authentication.
policy_tester_empty_state_description: You haven't set up any policies for this application
policy_tester_invalid_otp: Invalid One Time Pin entered by user
policy_tester_number_of_policies_tested: %{smart_count} policy evaluated for %{name} |||| %{smart_count} policies evaluated for %{name}
post_empty_state_feedback: You've created your first Access application. Tell us how it went!
private_app_delete_policy_warning_desc: This policy is tied to an <0>Access application</0>. Deleting this policy may allow unapproved users to access this application.
private_app_delete_policy_warning_desc_w: This policy is tied to an Access application. Deleting this policy may allow unapproved users to access this application.
private_app_delete_policy_warning_title: Are you sure you want to delete this policy?
private_app_delete_policy_warning_unknow: This policy may be tied to an Access application. If so, deleting it may allow unapproved users to access the application.
private_app_edit_policy_warning: **Note:** This policy is tied to an <0>Access application</0>. Some actions may not be available.
private_app_edit_policy_warning_unknown: **Note:** This policy may be tied to an Access application. If so, changing it may allow unapproved users to access the application.
private_type_description: Resources you host in your infrastructure that cannot use public DNS records.
purpose_justification_prompt_over_max_li: Purpose justification prompt must be less than %{limit} characters.
purpose_justification_required_descripti: Requires a user to enter a justification for any access to this application.
recommendation_access_group_description: A group allows you to configure a reusable set of rules that you can quickly apply across your Access applications.
recommendation_idp_description: Choose how users can log in to your applications. If you do not configure an IdP, your applications will default to using a one-time pin.
required_approvers_invalid_email: All values must be valid emails.
rule_action_notification_bypass: **Bypass** policies set a path that Access will not protect. You can configure IP or group-based rules, or set the policy to permit all requests with “Everyone”. Bypassed requests will still use HTTPS if it is turned on in the SSL/TLS dashboard. You can also set a page rule to allow HTTP to the specific destination if needed.
rule_action_notification_service_auth: The **Service Auth** type will allow systems to connect to the protected application based on options like Client Certificates, IP Addresses, and Service Tokens. This can be used in conjunction with or as an alternative to the identity provider login. A signed JWT will still be produced and forwarded to your application. In order to use the 'Valid Certificate' rule, you must configure a root certificate for this domain.
rule_invalid_error: There is an error with one or more of your rules. Check your configuration and try again.
rule_table_empty: No rules have been added yet.
saas_protocol_card_description: Choose an authentication method: Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) or OpenID Connect (OIDC). Once the application is created, you will not be able to change this setting.
saas_protocol_oidc_scope_openid_desc: openid is required for OIDC authentication
saas_protocol_oidc_tooltip: Integrates with various identity providers, enabling access using existing credentials
saas_protocol_saml_tooltip: Enables secure single sign-on (SSO) for enterprises across applications
saas_setup_card_description: To integrate Access with your SaaS application, you will need to configure the fields below with your %{protocol} application. The configuration will vary by provider.
saas_setup_card_info: To change the authentication protocols for this application, delete the application and add the application again with your preferred authentication protocol.
saas_setup_card_title: Your SaaS application has been created, set up your application now.
saas_type_description: Applications you do not host. Additional setup is required outside of Cloudflare Zero Trust.
scim_advanced_group_event_handling_desc: Select the events sent from your IdP to this application.
scim_advanced_group_syncronization_desc: View or modify the default group data sent from the IdP.
scim_advanced_provisioning_group_filter_: Write a SCIM filter expression to match the IdP groups you want to synchronize with the application. If left blank, all IdP groups will be synchronized. <0>View documentation</0>
scim_advanced_provisioning_group_transfo: Write a JSON data script to modify groups sent to the application from the IdP. <0>View documentation</0>
scim_advanced_provisioning_settings_desc: Edit the default user and group data sent from the IdP to your application. Recommended only for advanced use cases.
scim_advanced_provisioning_transformatio: Syntax error in the transformation JSON
scim_advanced_provisioning_user_filter_d: Write a SCIM filter expression to match the IdP users you want to synchronize with the application. If left blank, all IdP users will be synchronized. <0>View documentation</0>
scim_advanced_provisioning_user_transfor: Write a JSON data script to modify users sent to the application from the IdP. <0>View documentation</0>
scim_advanced_user_event_handling_desc: Select the events sent from your IdP to this application.
scim_advanced_user_syncronization_desc: View or modify the default user data sent from the IdP.
scim_connection_auth_url_desc: The endpoint where users are redirected to authenticate.
scim_connection_client_secret_desc: Securely stored credential used to authenticate token exchange.
scim_connection_credential_type_desc: Select and configure the credential compatible with your application.You may need to refer to your application's documentation for details.
scim_connection_oath_redirect_message: You will be redirected to log in to your application.
scim_connection_scopes_desc: OAuth scopes to request when authenticating.
scim_connection_token_url_desc: The endpoint where an auth code and ID tokens are exchanged.
scim_connection_type_bearer_token_desc: Secure API authentication over HTTPS, simple and credential-free per request. Requires secure token storage.
scim_connection_type_bearer_token_token_: A key used for secure authentication and data exchange
scim_connection_type_httpbasic_desc: Basic, less secure method sending credentials with each request, suitable for simplicity or legacy systems.
scim_connection_type_oauth2_desc: Secure authorization with grant types for precise access control and user consent in third-party resource access.
scim_connection_url_desc: Location where data is exchanged between systems.
scim_provisioning_card_subtitle: Configure System for Cross-domain Identity Management (SCIM) provisioning. SCIM provisioning automates the exchange of user identity details between Access and your identity provider.
scim_provisioning_no_idp_with_scim_messa: You do not have an IdP with SCIM configured. <0>Go to Settings to add or edit an IdP</0>.
scim_provisioning_no_idp_with_scim_modal: All configuration changes will be lost, but you can return to your application later.
scim_synchronization_additional_settings: Users and groups will be removed from the application.
Choose what happens to users and groups in the application when they are deleted from your IdP.
Users and groups will remain in the application as inactive.
Some applications do not allow deletion. Check your application's documentation for more details.
scim_synchronization_disabled_tooltip: At least one synchronization type must be active.
scim_synchronization_reset_default_messa: Resetting will discard changes to the (user/group) synchronization filter and transformation fields and restore default settings. Are you sure you want to proceed?
search_app_url_name: Search by app name or URL
select_type_description: If you're not sure, choose self-hosted.
select_type_description_no_zones: To protect a self-hosted application, <0>add your first domain to Cloudflare.</0>
select_type_title: What type of application do you want to add?
self_hosted_disabled_tooltip_no_zones: Self-hosted applications can be added once you have an active zone on Cloudflare
self_hosted_type_description: Applications you host in your infrastructure that use Cloudflare's authoritative DNS.
service_auth_401_redirect_desc: Return a 401 status code in service authentication rules on failed requests.
settings_binding_cookie_description: Protects against stolen authorization tokens. Do not use for non-HTTP applications that rely on protocols like SSH and RDP.
settings_cookie_card_description: Access checks all requests for a valid cookie that contains the user's identity in the form of a JSON Web Token (JWT). Configure enhanced cookie settings for added security.
settings_http_only_description: Prevents any client-side scripts from accessing the cookie.
settings_is_zt_app_description: Cloudflare will render an SSH terminal or VNC session for this application in a web browser.
settings_max_age_placeholder: Maximum number of seconds the results can be cached.
settings_options_preflight_bypass_subtex:
Send all options requests directly to the origin server.
This will remove all existing CORS settings for this application.
settings_path_cookie_description: Enable to scope this application's JWT to the application path. If disabled, the JWT will scope to the hostname by default.
settings_same_site_description: Only sends the cookie if the cookie's defined site matches the site requested in the browser.
setup_saas_auth_endpoint_sub: The endpoint where users are redirected to authenticate.
setup_saas_card_description: To integrate Access with your SaaS application, you will need to configure the fields below with your SAML SSO-compliant application. The configuration will vary by provider.
setup_saas_card_sub: Are you setting up an application that requires additional fields? Please <0> let us know.</0>
setup_saas_client_secret_hidden: The client secret will be hidden after you leave this page. You can reset it at any time.
setup_saas_client_secret_reset_confirm_d: Are you sure you want to reset this client secret?
setup_saas_client_secret_reset_error: There was an error reseting the client secret
setup_saas_client_secret_reset_modal_des: The previous client secret will remain valid for 1 hour.
setup_saas_client_secret_sub: Securely stored credential used to authenticate token exchange
setup_saas_group_filter_sub: Filter Identity Provider groups returned in ID token and userinfo endpoint.
setup_saas_issuer_sub: The endpoint where configuration details are retrieved from.
setup_saas_key_endpoint_id_sub: The endpoint that provides the Access Public Certificate that will be used to verify your identity.
setup_saas_pkce_sub: PKCE is an extension to the Authorization Code flow that prevents Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) and authorization code injection attacks. Only check this if your identity provider supports PKCE for confidential clients.
setup_saas_public_key_sub: The Access Public Certificate that will be used to verify your identity.
setup_saas_sso_endpoint_sub: The endpoint where your SaaS application will send login requests.
setup_saas_userinfo_endpoint_sub: The endpoint that provides user information to the application.
table_description: Manage the policies, authentication, and settings of your configured applications.
temporary_auth_desc: Requires a user to obtain temporary access from authorized approvers.
title: Applications
user_input_description: To test policy behavior, a user must have attempted at least one application login. Users synchronized via SCIM without a login event are not supported in the policy tester.
validation_settings_max_age: Maximum age can only be a number between %{min} and %{max}.
warp_auth_card_subtitle: Allow users to log in with their WARP/Gateway session identity. Users need to reauthenticate based on default session durations. WARP authentication identity must be turned on in your device enrollment permissions.
warp_auth_identity_description: Changes to this setting affect this application only.
